dialogues.text: Luke looks at the impossibly piled plate and moves off.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE AT A TABLE
dialogues.text: He is eating with great difficulty, finally puts his spoo down and his eyes close with weariness. Koko reaches over and takes a bite off the plate. Luke sits there and one b one the men get up and file out, each one passing behind  Luke and taking a bite until, as Deacon takes the last  mouthful, the plate is empty and Luke stands up and leave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Saturday afternoon. The men have just returned from the road. Luke moves slowly toward the barracks, Dragline helping him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made the week, boy. Plenty of  time to rest up for old Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move a few feet until confronted by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kean steps forward, draws a long line in the dirt of the  yard, barring the path, moves three feet back and draws a parallel line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Kean say that's his ditch. I  tol' him that their dirt is yore  dirt. What's yore dirt doin' in his  ditch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks up at them blindly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) I don't know, Boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Paul canes him and the other prisoners scatter. Boss Kean throws a shovel at Luke's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You git yore dirt outa his ditch,  boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke takes up the shovel and starts to dig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll! I wanna see you roll it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He canes Luke across the back, Luke digs.

dialogues.speaker: BARRACKS
dialogues.text: It is later. The men sit on the stoop, the usual Saturday activities.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: He is hidden up to his waist in the trench he has dug, ab three feet deep and wide and as long as the lines Kean dr

dialogues.speaker: MEN
dialogues.text: watching.

dialogues.speaker: BOSS SHORTY
dialogues.text: walking along briskly, feigns surprise at seeing what Luk is doing. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, what you think you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not stopping) Diggin' my dirt outa Boss Kean's  ditch, Boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shorty is carrying a hoe handle with which he hits Luke o the head. Luke slumps to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be damned iff'n you gonna put your  dirt in mah yard. You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting to his feet) Yes, Boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then git it out there. Roll it, heah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke begins slowly shoveling the dirt back into the ditch Boss Shorty nods with satisfaction and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (LATE AFTERNOON)
dialogues.text: The dirt is almost all back in the ditch. A shadow falls the dirt beside him. A walking stick falls across his but and he staggers to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah done told you to get yore dirt  outa Boss Kean's ditch, didn't ah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting to his feet) Yes, Boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how come it ain't done yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He canes Luke on the back of the legs. Luke falls and rol over and Paul canes him across the head. Luke gets up on fours and makes a rush right at Boss Paul. He is so weak uncoordinated that the attack does nothing but smear bloo and dirt over Paul's uniform. The guards beat Luke away a he falls on his back in the soft dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are restless, their efforts to ignore what's happ are futile. Dragline gets up and looks out the window int the yard. Koko leans over beside him. He holds the pictur DRAGLINE'S P.O.V. Luke under the lights, working again, slowly, dumps a sho full of dirt and hasn't the strength to move the shovel.  Momentarily, he stops moving and is hit. We HEAR the thud and the groan he gives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dragline goes back to his bunk. We HEAR another thud and cry from outside. Dragline begins to WHISTLE. Koko begins chink his chains. Onionhead and Dynamite join in with the chains. Other prisoners rhythmically beat on bunk posts.  Only Society Red does not join in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke works. From inside we HEAR the music from the prison Boss Paul and Boss Kean appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all this dirt in the yard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't talk. Paul hits him and he falls again on the di Paul hits him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Git to work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hit me! Please, for God's sake,  don't hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? What was that name  you said, Luke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. I pray to God you won't hit me. (he grovels in the  dirt before them,  tears streaming down  his cheeks) I'll do whatever you say, but I can't  take no more. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trace of smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kindly) You got your mind right, Luke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Boss. I got it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supposin' you was to backslide on  us, Luke? Supposin' you was to  backsass or try to run again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Boss! I won't. I won't. I got my  mind right. I got it right, Boss.  Please don't hit me no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music has stopped, the men listening.

dialogues.speaker: ON KOKO
dialogues.text: His face tightens into an expression of contempt, hatred. grabs the picture on the bunk beside him and violently te it in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kind and reasonable) Luke, you run again and we'll kill  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Just don't hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain steps in -- out of the dark. He has been watc from his porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, son. Go get shaved and cleaned  up and get you some sleep. I reckon  you need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke slowly struggles to his feet and begins painfully  stumbling toward the barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the chute opens and Luke staggers inside and the door slammed behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my mind right. I got it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stumbles toward his bunk, passing Tattoo and Alibi who turn away embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my mind right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Others like Dragline and Koko stare straight ahead, not s him; Society Red has his back turned; Dynamite, Blind Dic Loudmouth Steve meet his gaze contemptuously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (collapsing on his  bunk) Where are you now? I got my mind  right. You hear me? I got it right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang is working. Over a week has passed. Luke's wound are healed. He works in a slow, spiritless way, broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking somehow less menacing.

dialogues.speaker: BOSS PAUL
dialogues.text: He is sitting, not even looking at the men, relaxed, pull out watch looks over to Godfrey in b.g. Godfrey nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awright, smoke it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men break and sit down for smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke! Water 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a moments hesitation, Luke jogs over and gets the water pail and dipper from Rabbit and moves to the group men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Luke moves around filling their cups. The men are sile some embarrassed, some sympathetic, some confused, some  disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He signals with his cane for his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: ON RABBIT
dialogues.text: He hurries to the cab of the truck, gets Godfrey's rifle. The other men, but not Luke, watch as Godfrey slips in th bolt, loads, fires at something out in the swamp.

dialogues.speaker: ON BOSS PAUL
dialogues.text: As Godfrey takes bolt out of rifle, returns the gun to Ra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go git it, Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, Boss Paul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grinning, cheerful, he begins to hobble away through the  swamp and grass.

dialogues.speaker: TURTLE IN THE MUCK
dialogues.text: Luke's hands COME INTO FRAME AND OFFER the head a stick. jaws clamp down on the stick and Luke lifts the turtle up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grinning, holding up the turtle by the stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he is, Boss. Deader'n hell but  he won't let go.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: as Luke walks back through them carrying the turtle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cut that up fer lunch, Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves off toward the trucks with the turtle, and we HO on the disappointed reactions of the men, featuring Dragl Then there is the SOUND of a motor starting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they turn to look, as one man.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: as Luke tries to get it in gear, there is the SOUND of ge grinding and as the truck begins to move the bed of the d body begins to raise. The truck begins to move past the  prisoners, away from the guards.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GUARDS
dialogues.text: As they begin to run toward the truck, raising their guns

dialogues.speaker: ON DRAGLINE
dialogues.text: on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Lord!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fool. That damn fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh mah baby Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to run like hell toward the truck coming past.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDS
dialogues.text: stopping to fire but bullets ricochet off the rising bed the dump body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dragline running alongside trying to grab the door handle Inside Luke, grinning fiercely, as he drives. SHOTS sound Dragline gets hold of the door, swings inside. HOLD AND P the truck off down the road until all we can see is the s dump body.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE THE ROAD
dialogues.text: It is littered with tools and equipment dumped from the t body. The guards stand there, their guns empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from another truck) He's taken the keys. He's got the  keys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Shorty pokes his head out of another truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're free, Luke. You terrible man.  Think of that. We're free. Free!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over them, appears the SUPERIMPOSED image of Godfrey's  glasses, the Man With No Eyes, watching them, denying  Dragline's words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dragline is exuberantly hacking away at palm fronds to co the truck while Luke is filing away at his chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rattling frond) Shakin it here, Boss. Shakin it...  Oh my baby Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, shakes his head in appreciation. Luke ignores  him, continues to file. Dragline does another worshipful  imitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hit me no more, Boss! Don't  hit me! I'll do anythin' you say but  just don't hit me! Oh Luke. You are  an original, you truly are. You really  fooled them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foolin', Hell! I would have eaten  that dirt for them. They coulda used  my head for a shovel and a my face  for a broom... They just never did  get a piece of my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all the time you was plannin' on  runnin' again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke has filed through the chains, stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... I never planned nothin'  in my life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the severed chain link into the swamp and start to walk off, Dragline hurrying behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Dragline appear, tired and cold. Dragline is hav trouble keeping up. Seeing this, Luke stops and rests, lo off at church visible in distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoee, it's cold. Wisht I had  somethin' to eat. Bread, grits, beans  even. Soon's we get to my house,  we're gonna have us one big meal and  then I'm gonna show you some farm  girls that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't goin' nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) What you talkin' about, Luke? We're  together, you and me, just like  always. Now the thing we gotta work  out is how to get Koko outa there  and then the Terrible Trio be all  complete again. Man, this old Free  World ain't gonna know which ear to  stand on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you and Koko kin handle  it without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you mean, Luke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done enough world-shakin' for a  while. You do the rest for me. Send  me a postcard about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up, starts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Luke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke. Where you goin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what am I gonna do all by myself? (hangs head) Oh if'n I hadn't lost mah head. I  only had two more years to go. But  when I saw you tearin' down with  that truck... But you right Luke. We  oughta split up. Be safer for us  both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up. Luke is in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke? (calls out) Just the same, you're a good old  boy, Luke. You take care, hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Luke trots down the main street, passes the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Old Man! You home tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts across the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you kin spare a minute, it's about  time we had ourselves a little talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke mounts the steps of the lectern, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Man, I know I'm a pretty evil  feller who killed people in the war  and got drunk and chopped up municipal  merchandise and like that. I admit  ain't got no call to ask for much.  But even so, you ain't dealt me no  cards in a long time. I mean it's  beginning to look like you got it  fixed so I can't never win out. Inside  or out, it's just different bosses  and different rules. Where am I  supposed to fit in? Old Man, I got  to tell you: I started out pretty  strong and fast but it's starting to  get to me... When does it end?...  What you got in mind for me next?  Old Man. What do I do now? Awright.  On my hands and knees a skin'. Yeah.  That's what I thought. I guess I'm  just a hardcase and I gotta find my  way out myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the SOUND of vehicles outside, telling Luke that police have arrived. He starts for the back just as Dragl enters from the side entrance. Seeing him, Luke looks up the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your answer, Old Man? You're  a hardcase too, ain't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, are you alright?... They got  us, boy. They're out there thicker'n  flies. Bosses and dogs and sheriffs  and more guns than I ever seen in my  life. We don't have a chance, Luke...  They caught up with me right after  we split up and they was aimin' to  kill you, Luke. But I got 'em to  promise if you give up peaceful,  they wouldn't even whip you this  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) Do we even get our same bunks back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why sure, Luke. I mean I didn't talk  to them about that. But why not?  They're reasonable, Luke. Hell, we  only been gone a coupla hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand a thing, do  you, Drag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, you got to listen to me. All  you got to do is just give up nice  and quiet, just play it cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I always do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thass right. Just play it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Luke moving toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, what are do doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Luke steps out of pitch black into the harsh light in  full view, calm, slight smile, having chosen his moment. voice is loud, clear, mocking:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT WE GOT HERE IS A FAILURE TO  COMMUNICATE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT! It catches Luke in the throat and throws him back but he stays in the light, still smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON guards and police, FEATURING Godfrey, who holds his sm rifle. There are confused SHOUTS and movements by the  sheriffs, but the Captain and the prison guards only look toward Godfrey, then turn away, stoic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Luke falls to one knee, trying to hold himself up. Dra is by his side, helps him up and to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Bosses Kean and Paul move in to handcuff Luke. Drag seeing Godfrey, bellows out an INCOHERENT ROAR and charge past the surprised guards to knock Godfrey to the ground, tear his glasses from him. Confused, bewildered, Godfrey  gropes for the glasses as the prison guards beat Dragline into submission.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH, (PRE-DAWN)
dialogues.text: as Luke, handcuffed behind his back, is being led toward Captain's car by Bosses Paul and Kean. He is half-paralyz blood pouring from him. The Captain has turned his back o Godfrey, talking to the Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You follow me and I'll radio the  emergency clinic to open up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm takin' him to the prison hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's an hour away. He ain't  gonna last twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Git outa the way. He's ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he is brought past Dragline, who is being held by seve guards. Tears stream down Dragline's cheeks. Luke looks a him, still smiling as he is pushed into the Captain's car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it begins to move out. In the b.g. across the road we the Negro villagers watching, silently. The window of the car is up and the reflections on the glass make Luke alre dim, a little distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it moves down the road, over the trestle. It is the my hour of dawn, the sun's rays just diffusing as we watch t car until it disappears over the rise in the road.

dialogues.speaker: YOYO, (DAY)
dialogues.text: The yoyo is swinging in the sun. As the shot WIDENS we SE it is Dragline, wearing chains, wielding the yoyo and now SEE the others working around him. Godfrey is gone; Boss  Paul is now the Walking Boss. The MUSIC gains strength an speeds as Dragline works with strong, certain grace and determinati and the others also seem more vital and free as impercept the CAMERA PULLS BACK and RISES SLOWLY TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the men grow smaller in the limitless field of gold  stretching in all directions as far as the eye can see,  intersected by four roads that reach out to infinity. Now the men are specks, now invisible in the fields and there are only the roads, lines in the gold, going on forever.  OVER THIS, SUPERIMPOSE the PICTURE OF LUKE, now scotch-ta together, HOLD and
